item.title: Graduate certificate Review with Rensselaer at Work | May 14
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 14, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., in a 30-minute information session highlighting the whole range of Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. These certificates are three courses in length, developing targeted ability groups, and can be completed in as little as seven months. Please complete the form below if you plan to attend.

item.title: Removal of Unused Webex Recordings
item.description: As the semester ends, Multimedia Services highly recommends deleting any Webex recordings that are no longer required for future viewing or archival. This will ensure that storage space is available for all users for future recordings. For assistance with Webex recording management, please submit a Help Desk request.
item.author: Community

item.title: Pittsburgh Building Closed for Renovations This Summer
item.description: The Pittsburgh Building will be fully closed for renovations beginning Monday, May 12, and will remain inaccessible through Wednesday, August 21. During this period, no access will be permitted for any faculty, staff, students, or visitors. Please plan accordingly. Thank you for your cooperation as we work to improve our facilities.
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Confidential Counseling (In-Person) | May 13
item.description: Date: Tuesday, May 13, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits. Consultations will be conducted in 60 minute increments. item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: HR CONNECT - Your Wellbeing Matters
item.description:
May is Mental Health Awareness Month—a meaningful time to recognize the importance of work-life balance. At RPI, we are committed to supporting the mental health of our faculty and staff through services that help ease everyday responsibilities and stress so you can focus on the things that really matter to you. Join the Division of Human Resources on Wednesday, May 14 at 1:00 PM as we learn about the services A New England Nanny (ANEN) offers and how they can help you.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
